poem:
"Facades on the Dnipro"

Potemkin's peasants pantomime, 
The river's edge a stage of time.
Shadows cast by stolid husks,
A marionette's play of gilded dusk. 
Veined water mimics Empress' course, 
Silk whispers tell of hollow force.
To appease, we paint false gain -
The barren earth knows only rain. 
Yet from falsity, truth can glean,
In silent ripples, unseen.
